Cho Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1372 reviews

We stayed two nights at the Cho Hotel and it was excellent. We arrived very early in the morning but staff were very friendly and attentive and got us checked in with no problems.

The room is not that big but for a city centre room it was perfect. A spacious bathroom with a great hot shower and lots of free toiletries available at reception. The bed is extremely comfortable and the room has everything you could need. The location is superb, 5 minute walk to the MRT stop, the MRT is so quick and easy to use we saw so much of the city from this location. Around the hotel there are many places to eat and a walking market round the corner. The hotel provides vouchers for a number of different breakfast places near to the hotel. Cannot speak highly enough of this hotel. The place is very clean and the staff are really helpful and accommodating with lots of nice little touches that make it a fun place to stay. I would highly recommend this place for a stay in Taipei.

Show more
, United Kingdom
Hotel Midtown Richardson
7.9 Very good
Based on 6238 reviews

Disappointing points during my stay at Midtown Richardson: 1) elevator was very slow in accommodating guests, most specially during check out time and breakfast hours of 8-9:30am 2) breakfast is CHAOTIC!! I make it a point to wake up early so I can enjoy a leisure breakfast, so I find it rude that the restaurant manager came up to my room mate and asked her to move to one side so we can share our table.

This is unacceptable, since I feel that the table is for our private use and not for sharing! We should not be inconvenienced for guests who decide to eat at a latter time 3) I suggest that you have better Western food choices for breakfast. Maybe ham, bacon, croissant, danish rolls..... the buffet was predominantly Chinese food 4) it rained during our stay so I borrowed an umbrella to use outside the hotel, and to my surprise, I was given a pink umbrella. May I suggest that you order "branded" umbrellas for hotel guests. It will also be good advertising and image for your hotel.

Show more
Manolita , Philippines
Caesar Metro Taipei
7.9 Very good
Based on 268 reviews

We had a very bad experience with this hotel during our 4 nights stay. We are on honeymoon and decided to book a junior suite with the hotel because it is new and 5 stars.

But our experience with them were really disappointing. We didn't feel like we were in a 5 stars hotel, the quality of the service, amenities and facilities in the hotel made us feel like we were staying in a 3-4 stars hotel instead. Below are our honest feedback: - Location of the hotel is not ideal. It is a 5 mins walk to Longshan Temple MRT, but the nearest 7-11 or Family Mart is also near the MRT station, which is 5 mins walk away. There is practically nothing around the hotel. It is located in a very quiet district. - They addressed my name wrongly via email 2 times, first time it was Mr Jeffrey, second time it was Ms Cathy when I told them my name is Kathy. No service recovery was done. - We informed them via email we were on honeymoon and upon check-in, we told the receptionist, but it seems nothing was communicated to the receptionist, he looked surprised. Anyway, the surprising thing is nothing was done for us, not even a congratulatory note throughout our 4 nights stay. I really didn't expect this from a 5 stars hotel, zero service and personal touch, we felt like we were in a budget hotel. - During our arrival, there was no porter to help us with our luggage into the lobby for check-in. It was raining, hence, we were drenched while unloading our luggage from the cab, as the shelter at the foyer were not big enough. - Despite it it written as a 5 stars hotel, the bed, quality of furniture and amenities in the room were not of a 5 stars hotel quality, for example, toiletries were limited, bed quality felt more like 4 stars, no proper wardrobe, just a rack given, etc. - Very limited channels for the TV, only about 25 channels and it is the first time I stayed in a hotel in Taipei with such limited channels, when Taiwan is known for their 100++ channels. Plus the TV always hang an

Show more
Kathy , Malaysia
Taipei M Hotel - Main Station
8.2 Excellent
Based on 2601 reviews

after having checked out from 2 continuous louse hotels, i was losing hope but came alive again when i cheched into this hotel.

it is near the station, straightforward and dont really need to turn into mamy corners which is a plus point for people bad at directions like me. we booked a luxury family room but was given another one of a different layout as compared to the picture. we were on the 9th floor and there were windows but the view was blocked because just outside our room was like a roof top for pipes and aircon compressors and there was a parapet blocking the view. only managed to see the sky and the top of a newby tall hotel. but the room was good enough. the beds were spacious but on the short side. i think taiwan hotel beds are short. the bathroom was very spacious and clean. it is new and well kept on the overall. service was good too. the lady cleaning our room was kind and well mannered. all the staff were polite and humble. maybe not that efficient if handling in english but i speak mandarin so there was no problem. breakfast was at 10 floor which also serves as a canteen for free drinks and bread (loaf) and a toaster open for 24hrs, butter and jam left there all the time too. the breakfast was not fantastic, just ok to fill your stomachs, unlike the "default" spread with bread, cheese, ham plus chinese on the side. this was like 90% chinese. i will stay here again if i visit taiwan again.

Show more
Jen , Singapore
Caesar Park Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 7483 reviews

With Airport MRT express, it only took me 45min(35min train, 10min walking) to get to the hotel from the Taowian Airport.

I can visit major spots by MRT(red line and blue line) very easily. There is a place called HOYII next to the hotel where I can grab great foods! Bad parts are.. it is a old hotel, sound proofing wasn't that good, there is construction going on infront of the hotel(infrastructure related), but because of it's location, I will revisit this hotel

Show more
minjeung , South Korea
Just Sleep Hotel Ximending
8.3 Excellent
Based on 2797 reviews

Pros: - 5mins walk to Ximending. There's an underground linkway to Ximen Station beside the hotel, which can be useful if the weather is bad.

- 7-11 is located right beside the hotel. - Room is clean, neat and tidy. - Friendly and helpful staff. - Value for money. We would also like to thank the staff of Just Sleep Hotel Ximending in helping us to purchase sun cakes from two different companies. In addition, we really appreciate the assistance on the bank transfer. As we went during Christmas period, we received a small nicely decorated christmas gift from the hotel and it was hung outside our door. Kudos in making our trip a memorable one.

Show more
Hun , Singapore
Palais de Chine Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2790 reviews

Cupboard in the room opens in a unique way that is not uncommon, however, for a Hotel, it is very dangerous.

Especially for young children if theyy stumble on the hotel cupboards and open them without supervision. My wife did not want to wake me up and thus, tried to close the cupboard without switching on the lights, the cupboard's closing mechanism caught her finger and left a nasty bloodied index finger nail that is now cracked and still recovering slowly. Its been 10 days since we stayed there. We have highlighted this in a customer feedback and we hope something can be done. I am in the hospitality industry formerly, and its odd to have a opening/closing mechanism like this in the room. It may be an isolated case but yet, we cannot guarantee this will not happen to other in house guests as well. Other than this one issue, everything about Palais De Chine Taipei is 100%. We will come back and hope that some measures can be taken to prevent similar occurences to other Guests. I am not asking the hotel to change all the cupboards, just hoping maybe a message or something can be sticked, or maybe soft closing, cushion etc that can be added for the safety of guests and young children. Thank you.

Show more
Pak , Singapore
Park Taipei Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 6113 reviews

I was lucky to be upgraded to Suite room. New, modern and spacious. Very clean. I already had a good bargain for a room with view on 101 Tower so was even happier with the upgrade.

.. Service was good, very efficient. Breakfast is average unfortunately but still ok. I did not visit the other facilities so cannot comment on that. Hotel location was ideal for me - right at Daan station exit #6 you are literally at 15 minutes from most touristy locations - even National Palace is easy to access with direct link to HSilin station (red line). All in all, will go back again.

Show more
Etienne , France
Hotel PaPa Whale
8.1 Excellent
Based on 2251 reviews

1. Our rooms were assigned in the Basement. Hotel staff said that were the rooms I booked but it was not mentioning in Agoda.

It was not on confirmation and hotel voucher neither. I put my request “dislike room in basement level” when I made reservation. Hotel should contact me at that time but they did not. I had six rooms booked in total, hotel did not seem to care about your business. 2. Very poor security control. I asked for a second key for my room. The staff at Front Desk just gave me the key without even checked my name. 3. Poor water pressure at basin and shower. 4. Shower temperature was not stable. 5. Poor design of the basin & tap. You head hit on the tap and the glass top when washing face, brushing teeth… 6. Very poor sound proof. You could hear exactly what the people talking about from your next door. 7. Mobile phone had no signal in basement. Hotel wifi: poor connection 8. Fridge in room was not cold at all. 9. Need pest control - We found fliesss in room Pros: 1. Spacious room, compare to most of the hotels in Ximending. 2. OK location though it is not close to MRT. Easy to get taxi at hotel entrance. 3. Comfortable bed. 4. Nice seating area at Lobby as well as the small seating place on floor. 5. Good to have laundry service.

Show more
Kwok , Hong Kong
United Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 3763 reviews

I chose United based on recommendations saying it had a good location, friendly staff and great breakfast and all of those turned out to be true.

It served as a great base for exploring Taipei and northern Taiwan. Tried room service for dinner once and it was delicious (if a bit pricey). The deluxe double room has a bathtub and separate enclosed shower which was nice. Our room looked out on a old apartment building, so we just kept the curtains closed. Worth noting that I made a reservation with Agoda that showed free breakfast but they made my reservation such that breakfast wasn't included. I was able to get that fixed so that breakfast was provided, but it took time and some frustration. Check your reservation carefully if you use Agoda!

Show more
Paul , United States
WESTGATE Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 3751 reviews

3 days vacation in Taipei and for marathon. I chose this hotel because it is near the starting point.

I did not expect to receive 5-star service in this hotel. Greeted by very nice staff, check-in was smooth and they were all very helpful. The room is very clean with all the amenities, bathtub and automated toilet seat (really great !!!). The hotel itself is just next to Ximending MRT exit 6, easy to go anywhere in Taipei. Taxi stand is outside the hotel but I did not need them at all. The breakfast is excellent, very homey, delicious and always filled even though it was almost the end of breakfast time.

Show more
Nares , Thailand
New Riverview Suites
8 Very good
Based on 1378 reviews

Con/s: -The distance to XMD is 8-9 mins away even though the address says XX-XX-XI MEN. - Upon arriving, we need to wait for 1.

5 hours for room to be ready ( but it's okay we can walk 8-9 mins to start eating and shopping first) - The wall is quite thin, the crying sound of baby can be heard ( happen that we have 1/2 babies on our level) Pro/s: - The NEW Wing (is inside the OLD Wing, you need to check-in at the OLD WING) is very modern looking / clean / tidy - We request for "MAKE UP ROOM" every day and it's really pleasant to see that the room is neat and tidy after we came back. - The service team (bell boys, front desk, cleaner) they are all very friendly and helpful If you are really looking at the location right smack in XMD, this is not the hotel because it's quite far away from the train station ( it's better you request for a shuttle service provided by the hotel, every half hour) If you are looking for a nice, boutique, modern, quiet room and do not mind walking a little bit further,this is the place for you.

Show more
karen , Singapore
YI SU HOTEL – TAIPEI NINGXIA
8.1 Excellent
Based on 712 reviews

the room (standard room) is quite small and 90% of space is double bed which is not long enough if you are 180cm tall(I think it may fine to 170cm tall) but you still can sleep from angle to angle if you are 180cm or taller.

the available ground space is just enough to walk around but if you bring a fullsize luggage, you might not be able to unfold it 180 degree. the shower room and toilet is in separated room and separate from bedroom with ground glass, enough to hide you from your partner. the hot-cold water works fine, you may need time for adjustment. the breakfast can be buffet or a set menu (chinese or america) (I guess it depends on hotel guess number) the location is good, less than 10 minutes for walking to subway and just across the road for small night market. the room is clean, daily room cleaner makes it looks like you just check in that day. the staff is very helpful. At the time of my stay, the hotel just only run for 1 month. so, the room is very new

Show more
Kongphop , Thailand
Humble House Taipei
8.8 Excellent
Based on 998 reviews

My first time in Taiwan in a long long while, and my friend who sponsored the trip booked the hotel. Knowing him to be frugal, I thought he had booked us into a pension house, so I was grumbling all the way to Taipei.

I was pleasantly surprised. It was a grand hotel, after all. The room was fantastic: great bed and beddings, hi-tech amenities (power curtain, power sunshade and centralized room controls) and a top-of-th-line bidet that not only cleans, dries and deodorizes, but has certain settings that pleasantly tickles your butthole, making you linger more than usual on the toilet bowl. The location is primo, walking distance to shops for top international brands as well as Taipei 101. Staff is very friendly, solicitous even, and elevator has security features. Great city view from the window, and buffet breakfast is above par. I give it a two thumbs up. YEAH BA!!

Show more
Ferdinand , Philippines
Diary of Ximen Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 1812 reviews

The hotel has an excellent location. We booked two triple-sharing rooms, one of which got upgraded to quad-sharing for free.

Though the rooms do not have windows, the sizes are ok for the price paid for them. Our triple-sharing room had an awful smell which I hated, the other room didn't, and since we really wanted the two rooms to be next to each other, I opted not to request for transfer anymore. We loved how drinks such as coffee, milk tea, Calpis, juices (apple, orange, grape) were available to guests 24/7. We didn't like the hotel's breakfast selections though, I almost wasn't able to eat anything from the buffet spread, so much that I opted to have cup noodles for breakfast on our last day. Diary of Ximen's receptionists spoke good English and have been really helpful, especially Shia (?) with whom we booked our tour and airport transfers through. James, their partner tour and airport transfers company's driver has been incredible. He extended assistance to my grandmother without us even have to ask. He'd place a stool for when my grandmother would go in and out of the van; he lent her a cane when we went to Shifen, and a pillow when she decided to rest in the van instead of touring Pingxi with us. Pros: Price and location Receptionists and driver 24/7 free drinks Cons: 1 of the 2 rooms we got had an awful smell Breakfast spread should be improved for foreign guests

Show more
Jherramie , Philippines
citizenM Taipei North Gate
8.7 Excellent
Based on 314 reviews

Have read a few interesting reviews regarding this hotel and boy oh boy, you will be in for a surprise! The theme set for this hotel will bring a refreshing feeling, both to youngsters and people wanting to feel young.

The City view from the bedroom was great! The cosy room with all mood lights and TV can be controlled by an iPad, a bar on the 2nd level to enjoy some drinks (and they have a big table near the end of the bar, you can probably play some games there) and last but not least, hotel is close to Taipei Main Station Exit 7 (when you exit the station, you can see the hotel on your left) Would recommend anyone with an open mind to try this, as a solo traveler or as a couple, or even with friends!

Show more
Terry , Singapore
Grand Hyatt Taipei
8.8 Excellent
Based on 258 reviews

the hotel is well situated. it is modern and clean. the staff had been very attentive anticipating any service they can offer and yet not imposing.

when we requested for something, someone was sent right away to ensure that we got what we wanted or needed. someone was there to assist us relating to the tour that was picking us up. since it was also raining, they offered the umbrellas for our protection even if we did not request. the best service though was the help we got from the concierge who made sure we got a confirmed flight after our scheduled flight was cancelled. on our own, we had a hard time reaching the airline to re-book. we were very thankful to find out that a confirmed flight for the three of us was done without any hassle. i will not hesitate to recommend staying at the grand hyatt. the service was impeccable.

Show more
Isabelle , United States
The Okura Prestige Taipei Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 1759 reviews

I stayed at The Okura Prestige with my wife, two kids (3.5 & 1 year old), and my parents for a total of 6 nights.

We booked 1 executive room and 1 Prestige double. I was initially pleased with my decision to stay at this hotel (for the first time!) but gradually became disappointed at the service level of the hotel staff (primarily the front desk staff and the housekeeping) toward the end of the stay. The front desk staff granted us late check-out (1pm) but ended up calling us to clean out of one of the rooms by 12pm. It didn't leave us enough to time to get the baby and his stuff ready. When I went to the front desk to sort out the matter, the staff corrected the system record, agreed to let us have the room until 1pm as previously agreed, but only to add a closing remark that the guests staying I out room has checked in (at about 12pm) and asked us to hurry up. That really wasn't necessary in my view. The rooms were cleaned with only the beds made-up and towels changed. But the sofa, and rest of the rooms weren't. The breakfast selections on the 2f were limited when compared to The Regent but priced at the same level (approx. NT$600). I ended up going out to The Regent for breakfast some of the days. I was disappointed at the experience and don't think I will return anytime soon.

Show more
Daniel , Hong Kong
Diary of Taipei Hotel - Taipei Station Branch
8.2 Excellent
Based on 2723 reviews

Location can not be beat. Safe, clean, near McDonald's when you get tired of the hotel free breakfast.

Don't miss Pepper Cakes half a block to the left as you leave the Hotel. Incredible taste treat and few steps more is a hole in the wall coffee spot "E-Coffee". Nice little man with great coffee and a great price. Sit on the bench with the morning locals while he whips it up. We just loved Taipei, the City , the Metro and the people. They were so friendly and kind to our 11 year old son. The Hotel gave us a free upgrade and we did appreciate that as space is a premium in Asia. Within 30 minutes of being in Taiwan my son said, he wanted to come back.... We will use the Diary as our base again in the future. Be sure to get one of their free maps at the desk upon arrival. Very helpful !!!!

Show more
John , United States
Finders Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 597 reviews

Adjoining room is 2 twin rooms such small for each room without wardrobe. This hotel especially there's no any wardrobe available in any type of the room, only some hanger on the wall.

If family with children should book 1 family or double room with view and another twin room will be comfort for family 2 adults 2 older kids. Many games, activities available in the main ground floor and enjoy free drinks tea, coffee, water, biscuit, also free instant noodle. Kids really love these game, something for kids to play rather than others hotel only computer to play. Nice and enjoy if we back to Taipei. It's also close to shopping areas and you can easily get an ubike (Taipei shared public bikes) or MRT subway nearby. But the best part for me was meeting the owner, she's so nice and kind! You can communicate with her with Line messenger (everybody uses that in Taiwan) in case of problems or to set a checkin time. Was very happy of my experience here. Thanks!

Traveler impressions of Taipei

If you haven't visited much in Asia then Taipei is your choice. Taipei is like a mix of Japan (Osaka for specific) and Singapore and Thailand.

It is a great place for food as there are lots of night markets selling delicious yet cheap street food. It is a must to try the stinky tofu and bbq sticks there. About sightseeings Jiufen, Long Shan Temple cannot be missed, but the National Palace Museum... it is crowded with Chinese so you can skip it, you won't get to enjoy it though. The weather is bad, it rains all the time so prepare umbrella. It is a great place to visit in Asia where you can enjoy a mixture of culture and architecture just at one place

More about Taipei

Taipei has everything vacationers are after, from charming colonial districts and historic temples to magnificent green spaces and a hip, cosmopolitan edge. Tourists divide their time between marvelous attractions like the National Palace Museum, part of a collection that originated in Beijing, and soaring sites like Taipei 101, which once held the title of the tallest building in the world. In between are a wealth of temples, memorials, and traditional markets all worth exploring. The Japanese architecture and street markets of Datong district make it a great place for visitors.

The commercial capital of Taipei is the Da-an district. This is where the best street markets are found, including venues that specialize in jade, flowers, and electronics. The university and expatriate communities found here contribute to a fresh, international atmosphere. Ximending is another of Taipei’s commercial giants, and many of its boutiques, galleries, and art-house cinemas are kept in buildings dating back to the 1930s.

Accommodation in Taipei comes in all categories with budget hostels next to the kind of franchise giants seen around the world. Getting around will be convenient with a metro system near many of the city’s hotels. Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport is the city’s point of entry for the majority of travelers.

We are on honeymoon and decided to book a junior suite with the hotel because it is new and 5 stars. But our experience with them were really disappointing. We didn't feel like we were in a 5 stars hotel, the quality of the service, amenities and facilities in the hotel made us feel like we were staying in a 3-4 stars hotel instead. Below are our honest feedback: - Location of the hotel is not ideal. Show more Yi Wei ,Singapore Discover the neighborhoods of Taipei Ximending 365 hotels Zhongshan District 357 hotels Taipei Main Station 270 hotels Daan District 170 hotels Jiu Fen 167 hotels Songshan District 114 hotels Banqiao District 99 hotels Xinyi District 96 hotels Zhongzheng District 72 hotels Beitou District 70 hotels Datong District 69 hotels Shilin District 53 hotels Tamsui District 51 hotels Wanhua District 37 hotels Wulai District 32 hotels Xindian District 26 hotels Zhonghe District 26 hotels Wanli District 25 hotels Sanzhong District 23 hotels Nangang District 21 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Taipei 285 Guest Houses in Taipei 170 Hostels in Taipei 108 Motels in Taipei 39 Resorts in Taipei 32 Serviced Apartments in Taipei 9 Capsule Hotels in Taipei 8 Love Hotels in Taipei 1 More about Taipei Taipei has everything vacationers are after, from charming colonial districts and historic temples to magnificent green spaces and a hip, cosmopolitan edge. Tourists divide their time between marvelous attractions like the National Palace Museum, part of a collection that originated in Beijing, and soaring sites like Taipei 101 , which once held the title of the tallest building in the world. In between are a wealth of temples, memorials, and traditional markets all worth exploring. The Japanese architecture and street markets of Datong district make it a great place for visitors. The commercial capital of Taipei is the Da-an district. This is where the best street markets are found, including venues that specialize in jade, flowers, and electronics. The university and expatriate communities found here contribute to a fresh, international atmosphere. Ximending is another of Taipei’s commercial giants, and many of its boutiques, galleries, and art-house cinemas are kept in buildings dating back to the 1930s. Accommodation in Taipei comes in all categories with budget hostels next to the kind of franchise giants seen around the world. Getting around will be convenient with a metro system near many of the city’s hotels. Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport is the city’s point of entry for the majority of travelers.
